oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The condition number kappa(p)((x) under bar) of an ordered basis (x) under bar of a finite dimensional subspace of an L-p-space, 1 <= p <= infinity, measures the extent to which small relative changes in the basis coefficients lead to small relative changes in the function values, and vice versa. We consider an ordered basis (x) under bar of an arbitrary finite dimensional normed space and introduce numbers kappa(p,r)((x) under bar), 1 <= p, r <= infinity, which control 'near linear dependence' of the basis elements as well as overflow/underflow during computations. These numbers are defined in terms of the norms of the basis elements and the norms of the elements of the ordered dual basis. Optimal scaling strategies are determined. Effects of matrix transformation on these numbers are explored. If (x) under bar is an ordered basis of an inner product space, then kappa(p,r)((x) under bar) can be calculated explicitly in terms of the diagonal entries of the Gram matrix corresponding to (x) under bar and the diagonal entries of its inverse. In the last section, we define a condition number of (x) under bar relative to the problem of computing the ordered dual basis, and relate it to kappa(p,q)((x) under bar), where (1/p)+(1/q) = 1.
